label: Signed employment contract
description: Signed employment contract specifying position title, salary, hours, employment terms, and ANZSCO code. Must match the details in the approved nomination.
what_it_proves: Demonstrates the employment offer is genuine and terms (including salary) meet TSMIT and are no less favourable than Australian workers.
common_gaps: Salary stated is below current TSMIT — check current threshold before lodging
ANZSCO code on contract differs from nomination
Contract not signed by both parties
format_notes: Full contract including all annexures. If salary is base + super, confirm whether TSMIT is inclusive or exclusive of super.

label: Market salary rate evidence
description: Evidence that the proposed salary is at or above the market rate for the occupation in the location. Can include SEEK/LinkedIn salary data, industry awards, or comparable Australian employee salaries.
what_it_proves: Confirms the nominee is not being paid below market rate, meeting the 'equivalent terms' requirement for nomination.
common_gaps: Market rate evidence not location-specific (cost of living varies by state/city)
Data source more than 12 months old
No comparison with Australian workers in equivalent roles
format_notes: Print/screenshot of salary comparison tool with date accessed. Include methodology notes.

label: Business registration documents
description: ASIC extract, ABN registration, and any licensing documents confirming the sponsor is a lawfully operating business in Australia.
what_it_proves: Confirms the employer is an eligible and lawfully operating business for standard business sponsorship purposes.
common_gaps: Business structure changed since sponsorship approval
format_notes: Include current ASIC extract (dated within 3 months). Download from ASIC Connect.

label: Detailed position description
description: A detailed description of the duties and responsibilities of the nominated position, cross-referenced to the ANZSCO classification and unit group description.
what_it_proves: Demonstrates the nominated position genuinely corresponds to the claimed ANZSCO occupation on the eligible list.
common_gaps: Duties listed are generic — must match ANZSCO unit group specifics
Position is multi-occupation — primary occupation must be the dominant activity
ANZSCO code does not appear on the current eligible occupation list
format_notes: Reference the ANZSCO classification directly. Include percentage of time per duty where duties span multiple categories.
